summary: Buy American and other domestic preference laws require federal agencies to buy goods made in the U.S. These laws can be waived, such as when a needed item isn't made here. To improve transparency, a law required the General Services Administration to make a website for agencies to post such waivers. The Office of Management and Budget helped determine website elements and reviews the waivers...
title: Federal Contracting: Opportunities Exist to Improve the Reporting of Waivers to Domestic Preference Laws
